title: Inside Britain's messiest bedrooms strewn with old takeaways and dirty clothes
text:

Bedrooms are for many a sanctuary. A zen oasis of calm, comfort and tranquility, where we can unwind and de-stress after a hard day.

Then there are these pigsties.

Bed and mattress specialist, Bed SoS, searched the country for the messiest bedroom via a photo competition, and has revealed the 10 most untidy rooms.

Anna Wrigley, from Kendal in Cumbria, was crowned the competition winner after sharing her carnage of a room, featuring a half-eaten takeaway from the night before, Cornwall Live reports.

Having been crowned the winner of the competition, Anna will receive a brand new bed of her choice from Bed SoS.

Here are the 10 voted the worst:

Anna captioned this “The day after the night before” which, from the looks of it, was a pretty big night.

Sam Thomas is considering moving out after her boyfriend promised a romantic boudoir if she moved in…

We spy with our little eye… Christmas decorations?! Melek Gil’s room has become less of a bedroom and more of a storage space.



Philip Burch says he struggles to walk around his bed. We’re not surprised… seeing as there’s not much floor to walk on.

Jenny couldn’t help but post this picture of her daughter’s bedroom, worryingly this is it at its best!

Haleema Khanum has called this a daily struggle, but then again, you never know when you’ll need a sombrero!

Emma Fox’s room is serving a dual purpose; bedroom and launderette. Also, are those care bears?

Sophie has shared a picture of her daughter’s messy room. Looks like someone has been having too much fun with their toys!

Samantha Oakley promises that under all that stuff is a bed…

Danny Richmond, Managing Director of Bed SOS, said: “These pictures prove that we can sometimes let life get on top of us.

"Although it may seem like a chore, a tidy bedroom and a comfy bed, free of clutter, can have a huge impact on the quality of our sleep.

“Hopefully, these pictures inspire you to give your bedroom a tidy, to ensure you get a good night’s rest.”
